comments.body: This looks great! We could simplify even more now that we're using ZIO Test because ZIO Test automatically provides a copy of all the test implementations to each test. So instead of doing `TestConsole.makeTest`, you could just use methods like `TestConsole.getStrLn` and `TestConsole.putStrLn` to access the `TestConsole` in the environment if you don't need to create a `TestConsole` instance with data different than the default data.
that simplifies things a lot! I've left "reads from input" as is otherwise it would be identical to "feeds lines to input" and would fail if `feedLines` broke

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +6,10 @@import zio.test.environment.TestConsole._

object ConsoleSpec
    extends ZIOBaseSpec(
      suite("ConsoleSpec")(
